item.title: 50 shades of blockchain
item.description:
50 shades of blockchain

I've written about Bitcoin and blockchain for half a decade, and now banks are all talking about it too. There is a belief that the blockchain technology that came from the Bitcoin structure could revolutionise banking. But there's a problem, not with blockchain protocol, but with the hype and confusion that surrounds it.

item.title: Ethereum Surges Past US$15 In wake of DAO Debacle
item.description:
Ethereum Surges Past US$15 In wake of DAO Debacle

Ethereum is in an uptrend across all the main exchanges once again. After facing a lot of scrutiny over what happened to The DAO, it seems things have calmed down a bit. What happened to the biggest crowdfunding project in history is unfortunate, but it does not necessarily reduce their trust people have put in Ethereum.

item.title: Projections for reductions in price of hardware wallets
item.description:
Projections for reductions in price of hardware wallets

Bitcoin Stack Exchange is a question and answer site for Bitcoin crypto-currency enthusiasts. It's 100% free, no registration required. Sign up Here's how it works: Anybody can ask a question Anybody can answer The best answers are voted up and rise to the top The components of hardware wallets are not very expensive (at least when purchased as scale).

item.title: Powerful U.S. Regulator Sees Bitcoin as a Possible "Threat" to Financial Stability
item.description:
Powerful U.S. Regulator Sees Bitcoin as a Possible "Threat" to Financial Stability

The Financial Stability Oversight Council (FSOC), a group of U.S. regulators, warned that bitcoin and blockchain are threats to financial stability and noted they need to adapt to the changing market structure if cryptocurrency reduces the importance of traditional centralized intermediaries. The FSOC includes the Federal Reserve, the Securities and Exchange Commission and the Treasury Department.

item.title: Large-Scale Phishing Attack Targets Bitcoin and Web Wallet Users
item.description:
Large-Scale Phishing Attack Targets Bitcoin and Web Wallet Users

The popularity of Bitcoin is attracting all kind of attention. Unfortunately, that also means hackers and internet criminals start targeting Bitcoin users. A phishing campaign spanning over 100 fake domain names is threatening users all over the world. The objective is simple: steal bitcoins and obtain blockchain wallet credentials.

item.title: Bitcoin Uncensored Hosts Face Legal Action Over Perianne Boring Interview
item.description:
Bitcoin Uncensored Hosts Face Legal Action Over Perianne Boring Interview

Bitcoin enthusiasts are well aware of how Perianne Boring has been part of a controversial Bitcoin podcast not too long ago. Bitcoin Uncensored invited Ms. Boring to be a guest and answer some questions regarding Bitcoin and blockchain. But things did not work out as planned, and she is considering to use the podcast and its hosts.

item.title: US Regulators Voice Concerns Over Bitcoin Ecosystem Growth
item.description:
US Regulators Voice Concerns Over Bitcoin Ecosystem Growth

Over the past few years, the Bitcoin ecosystem has grown tremendously. More merchants are accepting cryptocurrency payments, both online and in-store. Bitcoin has always been a thorn in the side of financial regulators and policymakers. The Financial Stability Oversight Council voiced their concerns over using cryptocurrencies earlier today.

item.title: Discredited Craig Wright Working on Building a Bitcoin Blockchain Empire
item.description:
Discredited Craig Wright Working on Building a Bitcoin Blockchain Empire

The mysterious braggadocio, and ultimately debunked, 'Bitcoin creator' Craig Wright may not be Satoshi Nakamoto, but he is ambitious enough to be a Blockchain technology king. It appears that Wright has been working on building a patent-based Bitcoin Blockchain empire.

item.title: How Accurate is Kaiko's Bitcoin Price Index? - Bitcoin News
item.description:
How Accurate is Kaiko's Bitcoin Price Index? - Bitcoin News

Price has been Bitcoin's hot topic these past weeks, shooting to levels some are calling all-time highs but falling back before making a moonshot. But just how accurate is Kaiko's Bitcoin Price Index at tracking these movements? Also read: Trading Bitcoin on the Street: How's LocalBitcoins Doing in 2016?

item.title: Where and how can I buy bitcoins? I live in USA
item.description:
Where and how can I buy bitcoins? I live in USA

Answer (1 of 4): There are lots of ways to buy bitcoin. You can join an exchange like Gemini and buy directly. You can buy through a broker like Coinbase, Circle, or Uphold. You can buy through a service like LocalBitcoins, LibertyX, or Paxful. You can buy through middlemen services like Purse.io...
